Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed with trace of band in added white; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The lack of decoration on the exterior surface of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Chalice Style vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1204) (phase 2)
